meanings.definition: A slight knowledge or suspicion; a hint or suggestion.
meanings.sent1: She had some inklings that her friends were planning a surprise party for her.
meanings.sent2: The detective followed the inklings of a clue to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent3: The inklings of a secret plan made her curious.
meanings.sent4: The inklings of change in the air were undeniable.
meanings.sent5: His inklings about the upcoming test were causing him anxiety.

meanings.sent1: The student had inklings about the topic but needed more information.
meanings.sent2: Her inklings about the new project were slowly forming into a plan.
meanings.sent3: The inklings of a surprise party started to excite her.
meanings.sent4: The inklings of success motivated him to work harder.
meanings.sent5: The inklings of a solution began to emerge in her mind.

meanings.sent1: He had inklings of how the machine worked after reading the manual.
meanings.sent2: The inklings of the concept started to become clearer as she studied.
meanings.sent3: Her inklings about the plot twist in the movie were completely wrong.
meanings.sent4: The inklings of wisdom in his words surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The inklings of a breakthrough in research gave hope to the team.
